alert.note: Alert for Houghton; Keweenaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 22 at 5:29AM EDT until March 23 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Mainly freezing rain and some sleet today through this evening will change to mostly wet, dense snow late tonight and Wednesday. Snow may be heavy at times Wednesday morning. Expect total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches and ice accumulations up to one-quarter inch, but locally greater ice accumulations are possible over high terrain. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Keweenaw and Northern Houghton Counties. * WHEN...Until 8 PM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Ice accumulation followed by wet snow may result in sporadic power outages and some tree damage tonight and Wednesday. Expect hazardous travel conditions, especially tonight and Wednesday morning. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute and will impact the evening commute today and the morning commute Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There will be breaks in the precipitation today. Persistent precipitation will develop this evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
